member.name: T:Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.DeviceStatus
member.summary: Represents one status information of a device.
member.remarks:
A subclass should at least realize a property Value (normally an enumeration type) which contains the value of the status.
Further sub classing should realize a property DeviceSpecificValue and set the base class Value = MyEnum.DeviceSpecific as an indicator (see and its subclass in the QuantumX driver).

member.returns: Unique signal identification on the device or String.Empty, if identifier is not set

Measured value
State of measurement value

member.summary: Adds numberOfValuesToAdd triple (each consisting of one timeStamp, one measurementValue and one state) to the internal circular buffer of the signal. Do not use this function, unless you have to write your own driver for a not yet supported device! This is for internal use only!
member.param: Time stamps
Measurement values
Status of the measurement value
Number of values to add to internal circular buffer of the signal.
member.exception: Thrown, if numberOfValuesToAdd is less than 0.
Thrown, if size of timeStamps, measurementValues or states is less than numberOfValuesToAdd.
Thrown, if timeStamps, measurementValues or states is null.

member.param: Time stamps
Measurement values
Status of the measurement value
member.exception: Thrown, if arrays are not of the same size.
Thrown, if timeStamps, measurementValues or states is null.

member.param: Time stamps
Measurement values
Status of the measurement value
member.exception: Thrown, if lists are not of the same size.

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Signals.Signal.InitBuffers(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes the internal circular buffer. Do not use this function, unless you have to write your own driver for a not yet supported device that needs special adjustments concerning the circular buffer. This is for internal use only!
member.remarks: If you want to set the number of buffered values explicitly, set buffer timeout to 0 and min numbers of buffered values to demanded value.
member.param: Timeout in ms (buffer is allocated according to the samplerate of the signal and the given timeout)
Minimum number of values to buffer in the circular buffer (default is 1000).

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Signals.Signal.InitContinuousMeasurementValues(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the internal continuos measurement values. This method is for internal use only!

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Signals.Signal.Name
member.summary: Name of the signal

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Signals.Signal.IsMeasurable
member.summary: Indicates, if the signal could be part of a measurement (e.g. by using or ).

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Signals.Signal.ContinuousMeasurementValues
member.summary: Returns multiple measurement values gained through running measurement, e.g. streaming

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Signals.Signal.SynchronMode
member.summary: Defines the way the signal delivers measurement values. This may either be in an equidistant way (number of measurement vales within a second = sample rate) or in an non-equidistant way ( measurement values will be delivered at any, not predictable time)

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Signals.Signal.HasSampleRate
member.summary: Returns true if the signal uses a sample rate.
member.remarks: Asynchronous signals (like CanSignals may also have a sample rate. This may happen, if these signals will be sampled by the device itself, to meet a fix sample rate instead of unpredictable timestamps

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Signals.Signal.SampleRate
member.summary: Sample rate that is used to gather measurement values during a continuous measurement

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Signals.Signal.CircularBuffer
member.summary: Circular buffer. This is used to temporally store measurement values. Do not access CircularBuffer directly unless you have to write your own driver for a not yet supported device!

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Signals.Signal.ExcludeFromDaqTimeout
member.summary: Timeout in ms until this signal has to deliver measurement values during a running continuous measurement. If there are no new measurement values during this time, the signal will be ignored during the currently running measurement.

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Signals.Signal.IdleTime
member.summary: Time in ms since the last receipt of a measurement value during a running continous measurement. If IdleTime >= ExcludeFromDaqTimeout and still no measurement value received will be set to true and the signal will be ignored during the currently running measurement.

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Signals.Signal.IsExcludedFromDaq
member.summary: True, if this signal ran into a timeout and should no longer be used within a running continuous measurement.

member.summary: Interface for all filterable signals. Some signals don't have an associated filter, thus theses signals are not filterable.

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Signals.IFilterable.SelectedFilter
member.summary: Filter that is used to filter the measurement values during a continuous measurement

member.summary: Filter that is used to filter the output signal

member.name: T:Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Signals.DigitalCompressedGroupSignal
member.summary: Represents a digital signal that holds n digital compressed signals, that were all fed with the SAME measurement value. Thereby the bitmask of a digital compressed signal defines the bit of the measurement value that represents its own measurement value.

member.name: T:Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Signals.DigitalSignal
member.summary: Represents a single digital input or output

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Signals.DigitalCompressedGroupSignal.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Signals.DigitalCompressedSignal})
member.summary: Creates new instance and initializes the list of digital signals for this compression group.
member.param: Group number of the compression group
List of digital signals for one compression group

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Signals.DigitalCompressedGroupSignal.GetUniqueID
member.summary: Returns a unique string that identifies the first signal among the list of digital compressed signals
member.remarks: In case of a streamable signal, this method must return the information used by the streaming to identify the signal on the hardware module. This information should be retrieved during scan or connect.
member.returns: Unique signal identification on the device

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Signals.DigitalCompressedGroupSignal.Group
member.summary: Group to which all signals, collected under DigitalCompressedSignals, belong.

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Signals.DigitalCompressedGroupSignal.DigitalCompressedSignals
member.summary: List of digital compressed signals that all use the measurement values of this signal to calculate their own measurement values. Typically one bit position of a measurement value of this signal is mapped to one measurement value of a digital compressed signal.

member.name: T:Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Signals.DigitalCompressedSignal
member.summary: A digital comressed signal is part of a DigitalCompressedGroupSignal which delivers one measurement value for n digital signals. E.g.: A device that delivers one 16 bit value for 16 digital in pins, holds 16 digital compressed input signals, each mapped on one bit of the measurement value (according to its masked bit).

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Signals.DigitalCompressedSignal.DecompressMeasurementValues(Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Signals.DigitalCompressedGroupSignal)
member.summary: Updates the ContinuousMeasurementValues of this signal according to the ContinuousMeasurementValues of the digitalCompressedGROUPSignal by calculating the measurement values for this digital compressed signal according to its masked bit value and the measurement values of the digital compressed group signal.
member.param: Signal that holds the measurement values to map (according to masked bit value) to the measurement values of this signal

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Signals.DigitalCompressedSignal.Group
member.summary: Group to which this signal belongs. A group defines a logical compound of digital signals that are actually only one physical signal - e.g. a digital in port with n pins that are mapped onto one signal. Each bit of this physical signal belongs to another digital signal of the same group.

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Signals.DigitalCompressedSignal.MaskedBit
member.summary: Defines the bit of the measurement value that is mapped on this digital signal. Possible values are 0 ..31

member.name: P:Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Signals.DigitalCompressedSignal.MaskedBitValue
member.summary: Returns the value that corresponds to the masked bit. (E.g.: If the MaskedBit is 3, the correspondent value is 2^(3)=8 )

member.name: T:Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.TimeSources.NtpTimeSource
member.summary: The device uses the Network Time Protocol (NTP) protocol to synchronize its clock throughout a computer network against a given time server. On a local area network, it achieves clock accuracy better than one millisecond. You could use this time source e.g. when measuring a QuantumX and a PMX or a MGC device in parallel.

member.name: T:Hbm.Api.Common.DaqMeasurement
member.summary:
Class that manages data acquisition.
Use this class to execute a continuous measurement. Therefore you should keep with following work flow: * Scan for devices () * Connect to device(s) () * Add/Remove signals to/from measurement (, ) * Prepare data acquisition () * Start data acquisition () * Loop * Get measurement values() * Do something with these values * Loop end * Stop data acquisition ()
After a device has been (and prepared to your measurement task - e.g. by Device.AssignConnector, you can choose signals of the device you want to measure. Each of these signals has to be added to the measurement.
Call to let the API allocate the internal circular buffers of the signals and do further internal preparations like sorting signals into different groups for different sample rates etc.
To start the measurement, you have to call . If you use more than one device and the devices are synchronized (that means that the system time on the devices is pretty equal), you should start the data acquisition with . In case of a synchronized measurement, the first timestamp of each signal will ideally be the same (or at least as close to each other as possible).
To get measurement values, the function has to be called periodically. Until the next call to this function, you can access the measurement values under \of the signals you added to the measurement. If the measurement has been started synchronized, it is guaranteed, that each signal with same sample rate (distributed to various devices) gets the same number of new measurement values.
ends a running measurement and removes all, prior added signals from the measurement. So keep in mind to add the signals again before preparing/starting a new measurement.

member.summary: Groups the registered signals, if required. If the registered signals contain DigitalCompressedSignals, there will be created one DigitalCompressedGroupSignal for each compression group (specified within the DigitalCompressedSignals). A DigitalCompressedGroupSignal contains all DigitalCompressedSignals with the same compression group number. The DigitalCompressedGroupSignal will be part of the measurement, not the DigitalCompressedSignals.
member.remarks: This method may be used in concrete device implementations if the device uses compression (one measurement value for multiple digital signals) for measuring digital signals (using ). Then its useful for implementing the device specific methods and
member.param: List of registered signals (of one device)
member.returns: Grouped list of registered signals (of one device)

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Common.DaqMeasurement.PrepareDaq(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Prepares a continuous measurement
member.param: Buffer timeout in milliseconds. Used to calculate size of internal circular buffer. At least there is a buffer of 1000 values for each signal. Normally the buffer size is (bufferTimeout/1000)*sample rate of the signal, prior added to the measurement (E.g.: Signal.SampleRate=1200Hz, bufferTimeOut=1000ms => size of internal circular buffer is 1200 entries)

Maximum number of concurrent running threads that fetch data from devices and put them into the circular buffers of the signals. At least 1 thread is necessary. Max number depends on your operation system and the number of used devices. Up to 100 threads should be no problem. E.g.: If you want to measure 20 devices, you could use one thread for each device.

Min. number of elements that will be buffered in the circualr buffers of the signals that take part in measurement. MinNumberOfBufferedValues is used if minNumberOfBufferedValues>bufferTimeout*signal.Samplerate. This is important for signals that do not have a sample rate (or sample rate = 0 Hz) which are typically all signals with SynchronMode=NonEquidistant
If true, only the first timestamp of an equidistant signal will be copied to signals measurement values during a call of
If true, only the first state value of an equidistant signal will be copied to signals measurement values during a call of
member.exception: Thrown, if data acquisition is already running.
Thrown, if no signals have been added to measurement.
Thrown, if maxNumberOfConcurrentDaqThreads is less than 1.

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Common.DaqMeasurement.StartDaq(Hbm.Api.Common.Enums.DataAcquisitionMode,System.Int32)
member.summary: Starts (synchronized) measuring of all signals that were added to the measurement.
member.param: The defines the procedure that is used to synchronize differnt devices during the start of a measurement and also the way measurement values will be provided (DaqMeasurement.FillMeasurementValues).

Maximum time in ms, that is used to start a synchronized measurement. If it is not possible to start a synchronized measurement within this time, a Hbm.API.Common.Exceptions.StartDaqFailedException will be thrown.
member.returns: Maximum difference between time stamps of the first measurement values in seconds. 0 means, that the first time stamp of each signal has the same value
member.remarks: After the measurement has been started, the start time (smallest timestamp of all signals, that take part in measurement) can be found in StartTime. If the measurement is started the function returns 0.
member.exception: Thrown, if start of data acquisition failed.
Thrown, if data acquisition is already running.
Thrown, if no signal has been added to the measurement.
Thrown, if signals have not been prepared for measurement.

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Common.DaqMeasurement.FillMeasurementValues
member.summary: This function updates all measurement values of all signals that take part in measuring. In case of a synchronized start of data acquisition, it asserts that each signal with same sample rate (distributed to various devices) gets the same number of new measuring values. E.g. signal_A on device 1 with sample rate 20Hz gets the same number of new measurement values as signal_B on device 2 with sample rate 20 Hz! Otherwise (if StartDaq started an unsynchronized measurement, the signals get all measurement values that are accumulated since the last call of this function. This function also asserts, that there is enough allocated memory for the measurement values of each signal. So call this function periodically!
member.remarks: In case of an Signal with SynchronMode set to NonEquidistant, all received measurement values will be returned! No matter how the measurement has been started (seeDataAcquisitionMode).
member.exception: Thrown, if data acquisition is not yet started.

member.summary: Waits until each signal, that takes part in measurement, has at least one measurement value. To prevent circular buffer overflow, only the latest mearsurement value of each signal will be held in the circular buffer until all signals got at least one measurement value. This function will be called during the start of a software synchronized measurrement only!
member.param: Acquisition mode
Timeout until all relevant signals should have a measurement value

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Common.DaqMeasurement.GetLatestOfTheFirstTimeStamps
member.summary: Finds startTime (latest timestamp of all first timestamps of all signals that take part in measurement). Assert that all relevant signals already have a measurement value and a time stamp before calling this function!
member.returns: Latest timestamp of all first timestamps of all signals that take part in measurement

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Common.DaqMeasurement.GetLatestTimeStampDirectAfterStartTime(System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Waits until each signal, that takes part in measurement, has at least one time stamp behind start time. Finds first time stamp for each signal where timestamp > startTime and return the latest of these time stamps
member.param: Start time, form which to search for next time stamp
Timeout until latest time stamp should have been found
member.returns: Latest time stamp of all signals after start time

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Common.DaqMeasurement.WaitForTimeStampsGreaterOrEqual(System.Double,System.Int32)

Timeout until time stamps should have been found

member.summary: Goes through CircularBuffer of each signal, finds best fitting entry for given startTime and moves the read pointer to this entry (for all signals that take part in measurement)
member.param: TimeStamp that should be meet as close as possible

member.name: T:Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Filters.BesselFilter
member.summary: Bessel IIR (Infinite Impulse Response) filter is a type of linear filter with a maximally flat group delay (maximally linear phase response). They are characterized by almost constant group delay across the entire band-pass, thus preserving the wave shape of filtered signals in the band-pass.

member.summary: The Butterworth IIR (Infinite Impulse Response) filter is a type of signal processing filter, designed to have a frequency response as flat as possible in the band-pass. It is also referred to as a maximally flat magnitude filter.

MeasurementValues object to copy circular buffer values to

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Device.Reset(System.Collections.Generic.List{Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Problems.Problem}@)
member.summary: Resets the device to its factory default settings. Caution! After this function has been called, the device will be disconnected. This is necessary because the parameterization of the device changes by loading the factory defaults and the device therefore will be no longer consistent with the associated object model of the device. (When implementing this function, be sure to disconnect the device and to call to signal that the device has been disconnected.)
member.param: Warnings and errors that occurred during resetting the device
member.returns: true if no error has occurred, otherwise false
member.remarks: Notice that the device may be unreachable for a certain time and the device is disconnected after the execution of this function.

Thrown if there were errors during the preparation of the measurement (e.g. not supported sample rates or to many sample rates for this device)

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Device.BeginStartDaq
member.summary: Starts an already prepared (via PrepareDaq) continuous measurement session without waiting for any reply of the device. Use this function in combination with CompleteConcurrentStartDaq. This function has to return as fast as possible to be able to start as many devices as possible in a minimum of time. In a typical realization you would e.g. send the start command to your device without waiting for an answer. Use the EndStartDaq function to check the answer of the start command. This approach asserts that starting n devices does not take significantly longer than starting one device only.
member.exception: Thrown, if there was a problem during start of the data acquisition.

member.name: M:Hbm.Api.Common.Entities.Device.EndStartDaq
member.summary: Ends the concurrent start of data acquisition (initiated via BeginStartDaq) Use this function to check if the data acquisition of this device could be started.
member.exception: Thrown, if there was a problem during start of the data acquisition.

member.name: T:Hbm.Api.Common.Enums.DataAcquisitionMode
member.summary: Modus of the data acquisition.
member.remarks: DataAquisitionMode defines the procedure that is used to synchronize different devices during the start of a measurement (DaqMeasurement.StartDaq) and also the way measurement values will be provided (DaqMeasurement.FillMeasurementValues).

member.name: F:Hbm.Api.Common.Enums.DataAcquisitionMode.TimestampSynchronized
member.summary: Use this mode, if the synchronization of the devices should be done by using the timestamps of the delivered measurement values. (E.g.: A compound of QuantumX devices delivers equal timestamps if they are connected via FireWire cable. A compound of PMX devices should use the same NTP server to deliver synchronized timestamps.) Equidistant and not equidistant (asynchronous) signals may be mixed. Not equidistant signals have to sent values before given timeout in DaqMeasurement.StartDaq occurres.

member.name: F:Hbm.Api.Common.Enums.DataAcquisitionMode.HardwareSynchronized

member.summary: Use Unsynchronized to start a measurement without any synchronization.

member.summary: Modus that describes the kind of measurement delivery of a signal

member.name: F:Hbm.Api.Common.Enums.SynchronMode.Equidistant
member.summary: Timestamps of the measurement values of a signal do all have the same time delta

member.name: F:Hbm.Api.Common.Enums.SynchronMode.NonEquidistant
member.summary: Timestamps of the measurement values of a signal do have various, unpredictable time delta This is typical for asynchronous CAN sensor measurement values

member.name: T:Hbm.Api.Common.DaqEnvironment
member.summary:
By calling DaqEnvironment.GetInstance() (DaqEnvironment is a singleton!), the system determines all pluggable DeviceFamily implementations (by analyzing the file DeviceDriver.plugins) within the directory of the executable and registers them.
After that, you are able to query registered device families and you can scan for and connect to any device, that belongs to one of the registered families.
After a device is connected, the Device object contains the full object representation of the physical device. Each Device has a list of Connector objects. Each of these Connector objects has a list of Channel objects and each Channel object has a list of Signal objects and (in case of an AnalogInChannel) a Sensor object.
You may change now any properties of Channel(e.g. Name or Sensor) or Signal(e.g. Filter or SampleRate) objects to prepare your measurement task.
After changing properties of these objects, you have to send the changes to the physical device. Depending on the changed \objects, you have to call one of the functions * Device.AssignConnector(..) - assigns also all channels, signals, sensors and zero settings under the connector, * Device.AssignChannel(..) -- assigns also all signals, the sensor and zero settings under the channel, * Device.AssignSensor(..), * Device.AssignSignal(..) or * Device.AssignZero(..). If there are unfitting or invalid settings for the specific device, you will get a list of Problem objects that describe the problems, occurred during the assign process. Unfitting settings will result in a Warning, invalid settings will \result in an Error within this list of Problem objects.
When the assignments of the settings were successful, you can go on and prepare the data acquisition by adding certain signals of chosen devices to the measurement. This is supported by the DaqMeasurement object.
Assert to call before program ends.
member.remarks: Offers access to the whole system with all devices. A user should start here to find all devices.

member.name: T:Hbm.Api.Common.Core.Streaming.StreamingMeasurementSignal
member.summary: Decorator class for streamable measurement signals. The class encapsulates a common signal and decorates it with streaming specific functionality (like setting a the streaming unique id). Therefore signals don't need to implement any streaming specific details (except for implementing the abstract method GetUniqueSignalID in the common signal which must return the same identification string of the signal like it is used by the streaming protocol)

member.summary: Returns a unique string that identifies the signal among the device to which the signal belongs.
member.remarks: In case of a streamable signal, this method must return the information used by the streaming to identify the signal on the hardware module. member.name: T:Hbm.Api.Common.Core.Streaming.StreamingManager
member.summary: Encapsulates the access to the HBM streaming. Internally every using a unique session ID, so multiple parallel streaming sessions are supported. The streaming uses always sample rate groups (for each device separately) for measurement. Therefore only one time signal is internally added for each sample rate group to receive all timestamps at once for all signals of the whole group. The synchronization of the signals is disabled in the streaming layer (to safe memory and time), because synchronization for multiple devices is already realized in
